alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clinton, northern Franklin and east central St. Lawrence Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles north of Chateaugay to near Madawaska. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Altona, Bangor, Malone, Churubusco, Ellenburg Depot, Bryants Mill, Chateaugay, Burke, Merrill, Ellenburg, Constable, Earlville, Santa Clara, Irona, West Bangor, Mooers Forks, Duane Center, Cannon Corners, Ellenburg Center, and Chasm Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York.
